business.headline: Switzerland withdraws India's 'most favoured nation' status: 2 key impacts Switzerland will suspend the MFN clause in its DTAA with India starting January 1, 2025, increasing dividend taxes for Indian businesses operating in the country.
Work on weekends? This CEO expects employees to stay up past midnightKnown for her demanding schedule, Lisa Su often holds meetings at midnight and over weekends.

Billionaire blues for Ambani, Adani as networth slips below $100 billionReliance Industries, Mukesh Ambani's flagship company, has faced pressure in its core businesses. However, market analysts remain cautiously optimistic.

Swiggy share price hits all-time high today. Here's what drove the rallySwiggy stock: Swiggy made its stock market debut on November 13, listing at a 7.69% premium. The stock opened at Rs 420 per share on the NSE, compared to its IPO price of Rs 390.

Sensex, Nifty end in red as IT stocks drag markets; Titan shares down 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 348.55 points to close at 81,748.57, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 100.05 points to end at 24,668.25.
Explained: Why PC Jeweller share price hit upper circuit limit of 5% todayPC Jeweller stock: PC Jeweller share price rose 5% in early trade on Monday after a major announcement from the company.
Bitcoin hits record high, soars over $106,000. 3 things to knowBitcoin, the world's leading cryptocurrency, reached a record high above $106,000, driving positive momentum in other cryptos.

Ustad Zakir Hussain's net worth: How much did tabla maestro earn per concert?Ustad Zakir Hussain's family confirmed his death on Monday, following his hospitalisation for two weeks, during which his condition worsened, and he was moved to the ICU.

Sai Life Sciences IPO allotment: Check status, GMP, and listing dateSai Life Sciences IPO allotment: Investors who applied for the Sai Life Sciences IPO can check their allotment status on the BSE and Kfin Technologies Limited websites.

Why Narayana Murthy believes Indians should work 70 hours a weekNarayana Murthy has stood by his stance on work-life balance and his recent comments come amid continued debate over his previous suggestion that young Indians should commit to a 70-hour work week.

Vishal Mega Mart IPO allotment: Online guide to check status. See latest GMPVishal Mega Mart IPO allotment: Investors who applied for the Vishal Mega Mart IPO can check their allotment status on the BSE and KFin Technologies Limited websites.

Mobikwik IPO allotment status: Where to check? GMP, expected listing dateMobikwik IPO allotment status: Investors can check their allotment status online. They can log in to either the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) website or the website of Link Intime India Private Ltd.
Sensex, Nifty open lower as IT stocks drag; bearish trends continueThe S&P BSE Sensex was down 279.70 points to 81,853.42, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 74 points to 24,694.30.

Switzerland cancels 'most favoured nation' status to India over Nestle ruling The Swiss government has suspended the MFN clause in its tax treaty with India, potentially leading to higher taxes on Indian companies operating in Switzerland. This move follows a Supreme Court ruling affecting the interpretation of the MFN clause.
Bill Gates to go bankrupt? Tesla CEO Elon Musk explains howElon Musk claims Bill Gates could face bankruptcy over his alleged Tesla short position if the company dominates globally.
Uncovered: Network of suspected scam sites lure 'dabba' tradersIndia Today uncovers a web of suspected scammer sites posing as platforms for the "dabba" stock trade, an illegal practice.

Oh Gary, how could you: Elon Musk mocks US body amid Twitter stock probeA letter from Elon Musk's attorney, Alex Spiro, addressed to outgoing US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) Chair Gary Gensler, alleged that the agency gave Musk a 48-hour ultimatum.
Sensex, Nifty rebound to end higher; FMCG and IT stocks lead recoveryThe S&P BSE Sensex gained 843.16 points to close at 82,133.12, while the NSE Nifty50 added 219.60 points to end at 24,768.30.
EPFO key amendments: Now faster claims and more interest benefits for membersEPFO's amendments focus on reducing delays, quicker claims, and better interest benefits for its members.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Delhi air quality drops to 'severe' again, pollution curbs under GRAP-IV backOf Delhi's 37 monitoring stations, 25 of them had AQI readings beyond the 400-mark, with the worst affected areas being Anand Vihar (462), Wazirpur (446) and Vivek Vihar (446).

One Nation One Election bill to be tabled in Lok Sabha tomorrowThe contentious One Nation One Election bill is all set to be tabled in the Lok Sabha tomorrow (December 17) with the BJP issuing a three-line whip to its MPs to remain present in the house.
Many injured in school shooting in US's WisconsinMany injured in school shooting in US's Wisconsin

11 Indians killed in Georgia mountain resort due to carbon monoxide poisoningEleven Indian nationals were among 12 people found dead from carbon monoxide poisoning at a restaurant in Gudauri, Georgia. The victims were all employed at the restaurant. Georgian authorities have started a probe but confirmed there were no signs of violence.

India just ally in 1971 War, nothing more: Naya Bangladesh leaders on Modi postSeveral leaders of the caretaker government in Bangladesh criticised PM Modi's Vijay Diwas message, saying that the 1971 victory was Bangladesh's achievement with India just an ally. One of the student leaders of Naya Bangladesh called the message a "direct threat to Bangladesh's independence and territorial integrity".

Political gimmick: Canada Deputy PM quits after policy clash with Justin TrudeauChrystia Freeland, Justin Trudeau's most powerful and loyal minister, resigned from the Cabinet after the Canadian Prime Minister expressed a desire to shift her to another department.

Never considered resigning or fleeing Syria: Assad's first remarks from RussiaOusted Syrian President Bashar al-Assad, who rose to power in 2000, saw his regime collapse on December 8 after rebel groups launched a rapid offensive capturing Damascus.

Sri Lanka's land won't be used against India, President Dissanayake assures PMSri Lankan President Anura Kumara Disanayaka, who is currently in New Delhi, assured PM Modi that he would not allow any anti-India activities from his nation.

Zakir Hussain's beats of ecstasy: From India Today Magazine archives (1988)The late Zakir Hussain had a special relationship with father Alla Rakha both on and off stage. This 1988 INDIA TODAY article explores their artistic yearnings

Rohit Sharma and KL Rahul: India's best bet to save Gabba TestIND vs AUS, 3rd Test: India are reeling under pressure after losing 4 wickets for 51 runs in Gabba. Their best bet to rescue this game hinges on KL Rahul and Rohit Sharma, who need to find focus and power to bat well through Day 4 of the Test match.

EVM row: INDIA hits different buttons, BJP calls bloc 'biggest scam'The Trinamool Congress on Monday joined J&K Chief Minister Omar Abdullah to dismiss the Congress's claims on the reliability of Electronic Voting Machines (EVMs).

Germany stares at early polls as Chancellor Olaf Scholz loses confidence voteGermany to go for early polls on February 23, 2025 after the German parliament voted to withdraw confidence in Chancellor Olaf Scholz's government. The Free Democrats withdrew from the alliance led by Scholz's Social Democrats last month over disagreements about the debt policy.

What's in Nehru's Edwina letters and why a storm after 80 years?The Prime Ministers' Museum and Library has requested the return of personal letters written by Jawaharlal Nehru to Edwina Mountbatten, Jayaprakash Narayan, and Albert Einstein, among others. The focus is, however, on Nehru's letters to Edwina. What is in these letters that the BJP allege have been carted away by Congress leader Sonia Gandhi?

Explained: Why TM Krishna can't project himself as MS Subbulakshmi Award recipientThe Supreme Court has prohibited Carnatic vocalist TM Krishna from identifying as a recipient of the Sangita Kalanidhi MS Subbulakshmi award. This decision follows a plea by MS Subbulakshmi's grandson, citing Krishna's controversial remarks.

BPSC cancels Patna centre exam after official dies in ruckusThe Bihar Public Service Commission (BPSC) has cancelled the 70th CCE preliminary exam at a Patna exam centre following a disturbing incident where an official on duty passed away due to a heart attack after a ruckus caused by unruly candidates.

Cases against those giving money to beggars in Indore starting January 1In a bid to make Indore in Madhya Pradesh free of beggars, the district authorities on Monday said the administration will start registering FIRs from January 1, 2025 against those who give alms.
No, Soursop, a fruit, cannot cure cancer Soursop, a close cousin of the famous custard apple, is gaining buzz on social media for its anti-cancerous properties.

Watch: Daredevil Gukesh goes bungee jumping after winning world championshipWorld champion D Gukesh kept his promise to his coach Grzegorz Gajewski and went bungee jumping in Singapore after his thrilling victory against Ding Liren. Gukesh posted a video of the same on his social media account.

Chhattisgarh man swallows live chick. Man dies, bird survivesDoctors in Chhattisgarh were shocked to find an alive chick inside the stomach of a 35-year-old man who had allegedly swallowed it as part of a superstitious ritual to fulfil his wish of becoming a father.

Rajasthan's running tussle over Galta peethThe dispute between the Ramanuja and Ramanandi sects has put Galta peeth's future at the intersection of religious tradition, politics and judicial intervention
When fear rules the mind a bathroom becomes a bedroom; the absurdity of VaastuWhen fear rules the mind, you can make science out of everything.

Diljit Dosanjh dismisses 'Panjab' spelling row: Love India, don't need to proveDiljit Dosanjh found himself in hot water after spelling 'Punjab' as 'Panjab' in a social media post. Today, the singer-actor cleared his stance on X.

How India won 1971 War on water, sank Pakistan's Ghazi hunting for INS VikrantVijay Diwas: The 1971 India-Pakistan War, often perceived to be a terrestrial war, saw crucial action by the Indian Navy. The Navy attacked the Karachi harbour twice, crippling Pakistan's naval capabilities, and also sank PNS Ghazi. The submarine, leased from the US, was tasked with destroying INS Vikrant, India's only aircraft carrier.

Congress's 'erasing history' charge as iconic 1971 surrender photo swapped outVijay Diwas: Congress MP Manickam Tagore alleged the painting's removal was part of a broader effort by the BJP government to "erase or reframe historical events that do not align with certain narratives."

Watch: Kareena Kapoor along with sister Karisma, Amrita at Malaika's restaurantKareena Kapoor, along with her sister Karisma Kapoor and best friend Amrita Arora, visited Malaika Arora's newly-opened restaurant in Mumbai. Kareena opted for casuals, adding a blazer to her t-shirt and jeans, even complementing her look with a cap.

Watch: The White Lotus Season 3 teaser, release date out. Lisa leaves a markThe White Lotus 3 teaser has been unveiled, showcasing the series' shift from Italy to Thailand. This season features an entirely new cast, with just Natasha Rothwell returning as Belinda Lindsey.

Exclusive: Tejasswi Prakash, Gaurav Khanna to participate in MasterChef IndiaIn a first, MasterChef India ropes in popular actors like Dipika Kakar, Gaurav Khanna and Tejasswi Prakash as contestants, with Farah Khan hosting the show. Returning judges include Chef Vikas Khanna and Chef Ranveer Brar.

Did Allu Arjun's arrest impact Pushpa 2 box office? Trade expert sharesPushpa 2: The Rule continues its box office success, collecting Rs 1,300 crore globally despite the controversy surrounding Allu Arjun's arrest. The incident may have even boosted the film's performance, according to trade expert Ramesh Bala.

sports.headline: After slamming Kohli, Allan Border showers praise on Jasprit BumrahFormer Australia captain Allan Border has showered praise on Jasprit Bumrah after Day 3 of the Brisbane Test match. Border said that he has never seen anyone like the Indian pacer.

Hard couple of weeks await India if they lose Gabba Test: Dinesh KarthikA hard couple of weeks await the Indian team if they lose the third Test match of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy at the Gabba, said Dinesh Karthik. Karthik believed that Rohit Sharma needed to step-up to rescue the Indian team.

With every match crucial, the fight for the playoffs intensifies.

Has Virat Kohli lost his edge? Allan Border questions batter's mentalityFormer Australia captain Allan Border has questioned Virat Kohli's batting after his dismissal at the Gabba. Kohli poked a harmless ball outside off stump, bringing his downfall on Day 3 of the 3rd Test.

Virat Kohli's technique not made for new ball: Pujara after The Gabba failureAUS vs IND 3rd Test: Cheteshwar Pujara questioned Virat Kohli about his technique against the new ball. The 36-year-old departed after scoring just 3 runs at The Gabba in the 3rd Test.

How Dharavi's Simran Shaikh battled against odds to earn Rs 1.9 crore WPL dealSpeaking to India Today, Simran Shaikh's parents recalled her tough road to success. Unsold last year, the 22-year-old from Dharavi earned a Rs 1.9 crore deal in the Women's Premier League auction on Sunday, December 15.

Australia send follow-on warning to India amid rain threat in BrisbaneAustralia vs India, 3rd Test: India are in danger of being asked to follow-on in the Brisbane Test. After posting 445 on the board, Australia had the visitors reeling at 51 for 4 at Stumps on Monday.

Shreyas Iyer wants Prithvi Shaw to improve work-ethic: We can't babysit himMumbai captain Shreyas Iyer slammed Prithvi Shaw after the latter's woeful Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy run. Iyer said that Shaw was a God-gifted player and needed to realise his own potential.

Isa Guha is a brave woman: Ravi Shastri praises her for apologising to BumrahRavi Shastri praised Isa Guha and called her a brave woman for apologising to Jasprit Bumrah. Bumrah picked up his 2nd 5-wicket haul of the ongoing Border-Gavaskar Trophy series.

Rohit my brother, play with more energy: Hayden's message to India captainMatthew Hayden urged Rohit Sharma to bat with energy on Day 4, believing India's captain had a chance to redeem his form and lead the fightback after their top-order collapse against Australia in the Brisbane Test.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
